page.title: 07LONGFORGAN - THE KNAPP II -
page.content: The buildings of the Knapp evolved under Rossie Estate's control long before local Authorities exercised such powers. The burn once turned 12 water wheels within 1 mile, and the pre-industrial revolution mill buildings, dwellings and farm steadings comfortably marry traditional forms with a Tudor style. The materials used have developed through rubble with red (Rossie) sandstone dressings to, at the turn of the century, one of the earliest uses of mass concrete in Scotland. Much of the village core is so constructed although clever detailing conceals this, to retain the overall character. The now "Conservation Area" tries to protect and enhance the appearance of the district, without cold preservation killing off lived-in clutter.
